title: Zephyr dependencies for Linux
description: Installing Zephyr Requirements and Dependencies on Linux.

checkers.command: dpkg -s git cmake ninja-build gperf ccache doxygen dfu-util device-tree-compiler python3-ply python3-pip python3-setuptools python3-wheel xz-utils file make gcc-multilib autoconf automake libtool librsvg2-bin texlive-latex-base texlive-latex-extra latexmk texlive-fonts-recommended

steps.title: Install dependencies (apt)
steps.description:
Install the following required packages using `apt-get`:

```
sudo apt-get install --no-install-recommends git cmake ninja-build gperf \
 ccache doxygen dfu-util device-tree-compiler \
 python3-ply python3-pip python3-setuptools python3-wheel xz-utils file \
 make gcc-multilib autoconf automake libtool librsvg2-bin \
 texlive-latex-base texlive-latex-extra latexmk texlive-fonts-recommended
```

steps.title: Install dependencies (rpm)
steps.description:
Install the following required packages using `dnf`:

```
sudo dnf group install "Development Tools" "C Development Tools and Libraries"
sudo dnf install git cmake ninja-build gperf ccache\
 doxygen dfu-util dtc python3-pip \
 python3-ply python3-yaml dfu-util dtc python3-pykwalify \
 glibc-devel.i686 libstdc++-devel.i686 autoconf automake libtool\
 texlive-latex latexmk texlive-collection-fontsrecommended librsvg2-tools
```

steps.title: Install dependencies (swupd)
steps.description:
Install the following required packages using `swupd`:
On Clear Linux host system:

```
sudo swupd bundle-add c-basic dev-utils dfu-util dtc \
 os-core-dev python-basic python3-basic texlive
```

steps.title: Install python dependencies
steps.description:
Install additional python packages required for development with Zephyr:

```
cd ~/zephyr  # or to your directory where zephyr is cloned
pip3 install --user -r scripts/requirements.txt
```

steps.title: Check CMake version
steps.description:
CMake version 3.8.2 or higher is required. Check what version you have using `cmake --version`; if you have an older version, check the backports for your distribution or install a more recent version manually. For example, to install version 3.8.2 from the CMake website directly in `~/cmake`:

```
mkdir $HOME/cmake && cd $HOME/cmake
wget https://cmake.org/files/v3.8/cmake-3.8.2-Linux-x86_64.sh
yes | sh cmake-3.8.2-Linux-x86_64.sh | cat
echo "export PATH=$PWD/cmake-3.8.2-Linux-x86_64/bin:\$PATH" >> $HOME/.zephyrrc
source <zephyr git clone location>/zephyr-env.sh
cmake --version
```
